description: Generates a list of the currently signed-in user's registered passkey, or WebAuthn, credentials. Authorize this action with a signed-in user's access token. It must include the scope aws.cognito.signin.user.admin.

parameters.name: AccessToken
parameters.description: A valid access token that Amazon Cognito issued to the currently signed-in user. Must include a scope claim for aws.cognito.signin.user.admin.

nested_items.name: Credentials
nested_items.description: A list of registered passkeys for a user.

nested_items.name: CredentialId
nested_items.description: The unique identifier of the passkey credential.

nested_items.name: FriendlyCredentialName
nested_items.description: An automatically-generated friendly name for the passkey credential.

nested_items.name: RelyingPartyId
nested_items.description: The relying-party ID of the provider for the passkey credential.

nested_items.name: AuthenticatorAttachment
nested_items.description: The general category of the passkey authenticator. Can be a platform, or on-device authenticator like a built-in fingerprint scanner, or a cross-platform device that's not attached to the device like a Bluetooth security key.

nested_items.name: AuthenticatorTransports
nested_items.description: Information about the transport methods of the passkey credential, for example USB or Bluetooth Low Energy.

nested_items.name: CreatedAt
nested_items.description: The date and time when the item was created. Amazon Cognito returns this timestamp in UNIX epoch time format. Your SDK might render the output in a human-readable format like ISO 8601 or a Java Date object.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: The identifier that Amazon Cognito returned with the previous request to this operation. When you include a pagination token in your request, Amazon Cognito returns the next set of items in the list. By use of this token, you can paginate through the full list of items.
